io.netty.channel

Interface ChannelInboundByteHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTrafficShapingHandler, ByteLoggingHandler, ByteToByteCodec, ByteToByteDecoder, ByteToMessageCodec, ByteToMessageDecoder, ChannelInboundByteHandlerAdapter, ChannelTrafficShapingHandler, CompatibleMarshallingDecoder, DelimiterBasedFrameDecoder, FixedLengthFrameDecoder, GlobalTrafficShapingHandler, HttpClientCodec, HttpObjectDecoder, HttpRequestDecoder, HttpResponseDecoder, HttpServerCodec, JZlibDecoder, LengthFieldBasedFrameDecoder, LineBasedFrameDecoder, MarshallingDecoder, ObjectDecoder, ProtobufVarint32FrameDecoder, ReplayingDecoder, RtspObjectDecoder, RtspRequestDecoder, RtspResponseDecoder, SnappyFramedDecoder, SocksAuthRequestDecoder, SocksAuthResponseDecoder, SocksCmdRequestDecoder, SocksCmdResponseDecoder, SocksInitRequestDecoder, SocksInitResponseDecoder, SpdyFrameCodec, SpdyFrameDecoder, SpdyOrHttpChooser, SslHandler, WebSocket00FrameDecoder, WebSocket07FrameDecoder, WebSocket08FrameDecoder, WebSocket13FrameDecoder, ZlibDecoder

    public interface ChannelInboundByteHandler
    ChannelInboundHandler which offers a ByteBuf to store inbound data in.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

        ChannelHandler.Sharable

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void discardInboundReadBytes(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Discards the read bytes of the inbound buffer and optionally trims its unused portion to reduce memory consumption.
      void freeInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Invoked when this handler is not going to receive any inbound message anymore and thus it's safe to deallocate its inbound buffer.
      ByteBuf newInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Return the ByteBuf which will be used for inbound data for the given ChannelHandlerContext.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelStateHandler

        channelActive, channelInactive, channelReadSuspended, channelRegistered, channelUnregistered, inboundBufferUpdated, userEventTriggered

      • Methods inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

        afterAdd, afterRemove, beforeAdd, beforeRemove, exceptionCaught

    • Method Detail

      • newInboundBuffer

        ByteBuf newInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                         throws Exception
        Return the ByteBuf which will be used for inbound data for the given ChannelHandlerContext. Implementations should take ChannelConfig.getDefaultHandlerByteBufType() into account.

        Use of ChannelHandlerUtil.allocate(ChannelHandlerContext) is adviced.

        Throws:
        Exception

      • discardInboundReadBytes

        void discardInboundReadBytes(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                             throws Exception
        Discards the read bytes of the inbound buffer and optionally trims its unused portion to reduce memory consumption. The most common implementation of this method will look like the following: 
             ctx.inboundByteBuffer().discardSomeReadBytes();
        Throws:
        Exception

      • freeInboundBuffer

        void freeInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                       throws Exception
        Invoked when this handler is not going to receive any inbound message anymore and thus it's safe to deallocate its inbound buffer.
        Throws:
        Exception
